gurmukhi: sRI hir jl ko AsqR clwXo ] so Cut kY niRp aupr AwXo ] brn isMG mUriq Dir Awey ] srqn kI sYnw sMg lXwey ]1482]
transliteration: Srihar(i) Jal Ko Astra Chalaayo|| So Chhout Kai Nrip Aayo|| Baran Singh Moondat(i) Dhar(i) Aae|| Sartan Kisainaa San Lyaae||1482||
translation: Then Krishna discharged his Varunastra (arm in relation to god Varuna), which hit the king Kharag Singh; Varuna reached there, assuming the form of a lion and brought with him the army of streams.1482.

gurmukhi: Awvq isMGn Sbid sunwXo ] bwr rwj Aiq irs kir DwXo ] sunq Sbd kwNpy pur qIno ] ien niRp mn mY qRws n kIno ]1483]
transliteration: Oovat Singhan Shabad(i) Sounaayo|| Baar Raaj At(i) Ris Kar(i) Dhaayo|| Sounat Shabad Kaanpe Pur Teeno|| In Nrip Man Mai Traas Na Keeno||1483||
translation: On arrival, Varuna blew the horn (roaring like a lion) and in fury fell upon the king; listening to the dreadful roar, all the three worlds trembled, but the king Kharag Singh did not become fearful.1483.

gurmukhi: bwnn swNg jlwiDm ko kiv sXwm BnY qn qwVn kIno ] swqhu isMDn ko irs kY sr jwln isau aur Cyd kY dIno ]
transliteration: Baanan Saan Jalaadhip Ko Kavi Syaam Bhanai Tan Taadan Keeno|| Saatoh Sindhan Ko Ris Kai Sar Jalan Sio Ur Chhedkai Deeno||
translation: With his lance-like arrows, the king slashed the body of Varuna; the king, in great fury pierced the heart of the seven oceans;

gurmukhi: Gwiel kY srqw sgrI bhu sRonq so iqh ko AMg BIno ] nYku n TwF rihE rx mYN jl rwj BijE giH ko mg lIno ]1484]
transliteration: Ghaail Kai Sartaa Sagribahu Sronat So Tih Ko An Bheeno|| Naik(u) Na Thaadh Rahio Ran Main Jal Raaj Bhajio Grah(i) Ko Mag Leeno||1484||
translation: Wounding all the streams, he saturated their limbs with blood; the king of water (Varuna) could not stay in the battlefield and ran away towards his hime.1484.

gurmukhi: jbY jlwiDp Dwm isDwry ] qb hir ko niRp pun sr mwry ] qb jm ko hir AsqR clwXo ] hÍY pRq`C jm niRp pr DwXo ]1485]
transliteration: Jabai Jalaadhip Dhaam Sidhdare|| Tab Har(i) Ko Nrip Poun Sar Mdare|| Tab Jam Ko Har(i) Astra Chalaayo|| Hvai Pratachchh Jam Nrip Par Dhaayo||1485||
translation: When Varuna went away to his home, the king then discharged his arrows on Krishna; at that time, Krishna shot his arm of Yama and thereby Yama manifested himself and fell upon the king.1485.

gurmukhi: bIr bfo ibkR dYNq su nwmih kop hÍY sRI KVgyS pY DwXo ] bwn kmwn kiRpwn gdw brCI kr lY Aiq ju`D mcwXo ]
transliteration: Beer Bado Bikra Daint Su Naamah(i) Kop Hvai Srikhadgesh Pai Dhaayo|| Baan Kamaan Kridaan Gadaa Barchhikar Lai At(i) Juddh Machadyo||
translation: The demon named Vikrat, greatly infuriated, fell upon the king Kharag Singh and taking up his bow, arrows, sword, mace, lance etc., he waged a dreadful war;

gurmukhi: qIr clwvq BXo bhuro qb qw Cib ko kiv BwK sunwXo ] BUp ko bwn mno Kgrwj kitXo Air ko sr nwg igrwXo ]1486]
transliteration: Tir Chadaavat Bhyo Bahuro Tab Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kavi Bhaakh Sounaayo|| Bhoop Ko Baan Mano Khagraaj Katiyo Ar(i) Ko Ar Naag Giraayo||1486||
translation: Continuing the discharge of his arrows, he manifested himself in many figures; the poet says that in this war, the arrow of the king was hitting like Garuda and knocking down of the cobra of the arrow of the enemy.1486.

gurmukhi: ib`kRq ko niRp mwr lXo jm ko irs kY pun au`qr dIno ] kw BXo jo ijX mwr Gny Aru dMf vfo kr mY qum lIno ]
transliteration: Bikkra Ko Nrip Maar Layo Jam Ko Ris Kai Poun Outtar Deeno|| Kaa Bhayo Jo Jiya Maar Ghane Ar(u) Dand Vado Kar Mai Toum Leeno||
translation: After killing Vikrat, the king said to Yama, “What then, if you have killed many people till now and you are carrying a very large staff in your hand;

gurmukhi: qoih n jIAq Cwfq ho sun ry Ab moih iehY pRn kIno ] mwrq hoN kr lY krno kCu mo bl jwnq hY pur qIno ]1487]
transliteration: Toh(i) Na Jeeat Chhaadat Ho Soun Re Ab Moh(i) Ihai Pran Keeno|| Maatat Hon Kar Lai Karno Kachhu Mo Bal Jaanat Hai Pur Teeno||1487||
translation: “I have taken a vow today that I shall kill you; I am going to kill you; you may do whatever you think in your mind, because all the three worlds are aware of my strength.”1487.
